Content / Social Media Manager Job at Kabsa Facility Managers Limited




        
    

        
        Kabsa Facility Managers Limited is a skills ecosytem hub that offers a wide range of facility management services to clients of all categories. Our services range from janitorial, corporate housekeeping, handyman, home repairs, painting, tiling, electrical repairs, property management and real estate marketing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content / Social Media Manager

Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly creative and strategic Content/Social Media Manager to lead our digital storytelling efforts across all online platforms. T
	his role is ideal for a passionate communicator who understands audience behavior, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and excels at producing content that converts engagement into impact.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and optimize a robust content strategy aligned with organizational goals.
	Create, curate, and schedule high-quality content (copy, graphics, short videos, campaigns) across social media channels.
	Manage community interactions, respond to comments, monitor conversations, and nurture online relationships.
	Track analytics and performance metrics to refine content, improve reach, and strengthen brand positioning.
	Lead digital campaigns from ideation through execution, ensuring innovation in storytelling and engagement.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to maintain consistent messaging and branding.


Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s degree in relevant courses with proven experience in practice.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in content creation, digital marketing, or social media management.
	Strong writing, editing, and conceptual skills.
	Proficiency in Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, and major social media management tools.
	Demonstrated creativity, trend awareness, and ability to build engaged online communities.


Working conditions:


	We aim to have the successful candidate start immediately.


What We Offer


	Competitive Salary: N250,000 – N400,000 Monthly.
	HMO
	Pension plan.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letters to: ekasaarh@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer

Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description

	We are hiring a versatile and innovative IT Officer to maintain, strengthen, and secure our technology infrastructure while also supporting the organization’s digital media, design, and web presence.
	This role is ideal for a tech-savvy professional who blends strong IT expertise with creative digital skills.


Responsibilities
Technical & Systems Support:


	Provide timely technical support to staff—troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues.
	Administer and maintain IT systems, servers, user accounts, and access controls.
	Ensure cybersecurity protocols, data protection standards, and system updates are consistently implemented.
	Oversee network configuration, monitoring, and performance optimization.
	Recommend, implement, and document technology improvements to enhance operational efficiency and security.


Digital Media, Web & Design Support:


	Design and produce graphic materials for digital and print use (e.g., social media content, presentations, reports).
	Edit and produce video content for internal and external communication.
	Manage and update the organization’s website; support web development tasks, UX improvements, and performance optimization.
	Oversee digital media channels, ensuring consistent content quality, branding, and technical functionality.
	Collaborate with teams to support multimedia needs for campaigns, events, and organizational communications.


Requirements


	A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Communication Technology, or other related courses.
	5 – 7 years’ experience in IT support, systems administration, or a related field.
	Proven experience in graphic design, video editing, web development, or web content management.
	Strong diagnostic, troubleshooting, and analytical skills.
	In-depth knowledge of network systems, security frameworks, and current technology trends.
	Proficiency in design and editing tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, or equivalents).
	Familiarity with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress), basic front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JS), and web optimization.
	Ability to communicate technical information clearly to non-technical users and collaborate across teams.

From our roots as the pioneer in pay-as-you-go “PayGo’” solar energy for off grid homes, we have grown into one of the most advanced connected asset financing platforms in the world, empowering a broad range of customers to achieve progress in their lives.
